thread.title: Cahill’s response to ref abuse suspension
thread.title_full: Cahill’s response to ref abuse suspension

title: Cahill’s response to ref abuse suspension
text:
Cahill sent for early shower 1:01 Melbourne Derby: Tim Cahill speaks after receiving one game ban for a red card for abusing the referee February 7, 2017 8:27am by Staff writers Source: FOX SPORTS SOCCEROOS legend Tim Cahill has spoken for the first time after receiving a suspension for abusing referee Chris Beath in a heated Melbourne Derby on Saturday night. 
A one game ban was confirmed on Monday afternoon after the Melbourne City marquee was sent off before stepping foot on the field in the final minutes of the 2-1 loss to Victory. 
It was revealed Cahill had called Beath a “f***ing disgrace” after telling him to look at the big screen following Victory’s controversial goal to go ahead in the Derby. 
FFA’s suspension means Cahill will miss a vital game against Brisbane Roar, alongside Dean Bouzanis, Bruno Fornaroli, Fernando Brandan, Luke Brattan, Manny Muscat and Osama Malik. 
In response to the ban, Cahill posted a message on Instagram apologising for his touchline behaviour. Cahill sent in derby meltdown 1:18 
“I want to address what happened in the Derby on Saturday night,” Cahill wrote. “I sincerely apologise to Chris Beath for my reaction. 
“My behaviour also hurt the game so I also apologise to my team, to Melbourne Victory and to all the fans at the game and watching at home. 
“Regardless of whatever happens on the pitch, I have to respect the game and the officials. I want the game to grow in Australia and I want to do all I can to help that happen. No matter the situation, I have to set an example and be accountable for my words and actions. 
“My job now is to focus totally on football and winning as many games as possible.” A photo posted by Tim Cahill (@tim_cahill) on Feb 6, 2017 at 12:43am PST View All Comments The latest sports news, in your inbox daily. Email
